intro: Cerdana exaltata, commonly known as the tall cerdana, is a species of flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy inflorescences. The plant typically features lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of tubular flowers in shades of red, pink, or purple. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or shaded areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
